children.subject: Website for summer iterations can be found at: cs61bl.org

history.content:
The structure of 61BL is 3 hours of lab / 4 days a week, and a lecture on the remaining day. Since labs run back-to-back all day, there aren't typically homework or project parties outside of this regular schedule. Nonetheless, this isn't really a problem since you can always walk into any lab and ask for help as if it were office hours. Also since it is summer, many of the TAs and fellow students have more time to engage with the course and provide support (it isn't uncommon for your TA to know your name and to chat with you one-on-one regularly during lab).

In terms of assignments, there are daily lab assignments which serve as the primary source of learning. There are also a couple projects. Other than that, there are no additional homework assignments.

Here's last summer's course website: http://www.cs61bl.org/su17/

I'm planning on taking 61B during the summer and am hoping to gain some insight on the course.  I'm nervous that, given the rapid pace of the material, I won't have many opportunities to allow concepts to sink in through extra resources such as CSM, extra sections, or one-on-one tutoring.
  1. Can anyone speak to the support available outside of the lab/class?
  2. I also noticed there aren't class websites for summer courses? What other mediums are available?
  3. Will there be homework parties and project parties, as there are during a regular semester? Are these usually held at night, too?

I'd appreciate any information!
history.subject: Summer 61BL course logistics
